virtual bool havePartonicEvent ()

Event content access
All methods in this group return a list of fastjet::PseudoJet objects representing the requested part of the (particle/hadron level) event.

Note:
Particles may be subjected to general filters (final state selectors) if the Event object receives a valid pointer to one of those at its construction.
Todo:
Access to partonic information not yet implemented.

Detailed Description

Basic event container provides access to the full (signal+pile-up), the signal,and the pile-up final state of a given event - if available. It accommodates simple filters on all particles.

Note:
While it is recommend to use only same Event object for all full events to be analyzed, clients have to clear the cache in this object before loading a full new event!

Add a list of particles represented by fastjet::PseudoJet.

Parameters:
[in] reference to non-modifiable list of fastjet::PseudoJet objects
It is expected that each fastjet::PseudoJet has a ParticleInfo objects attached, otherwise the vertex allocation will fail.

Todo:

int Event::nVertices (  )  const [virtual]

Access number of vertices.

Returns:
Number of vertices in event. In case of a merged signal and pile-up event, this number is given by the number of pile-up collisions mu merged with the signal, meaning this method returns `mu + 1`.

std::vector< fastjet::PseudoJet > Event::pseudoJets ( bool  charged,
Vertex::InteractionType  type 
) [virtual]

Retrieve all charged/neutral particles from a given source.

Identical to Event::pseudoJets(Vertex::InteractionType type) , with an additional charge (or neutral) filter

Parameters:
[in] charged retrieve charged particles if true, else neutrals.
[in] type particle source specification

std::vector< fastjet::PseudoJet > Event::pseudoJets ( Vertex::InteractionType  type  )  [virtual]

Retrieve all particles from a given source.

Parameters:
[in] type particle source specification
An example: 
 {.cpp}
     Event*       pEvt = new Event;            // get a new Event
     long long    nPtrPU(0);                   // initialize record counter
     long long    nPtrS(0);                    // initialize record counter
     MyRawPUData* pPURaw = new MyRawPUData();  // pile-up stream
     MyRawSData*  pSRaw  = new MyRawSData();   // signal stream
     ...
     DataHandler<MyRawPUData> puHdlr = new DataHandler<MyRawPUData>();
     DataHandler<MyRawSData>  psHdlr = new DataHandler<MyRawSData>();
     
     while ( !psHdlr->fill(*pSRaw,*pEvt,nPtrS,-1,0,Vertex::SIGNAL) &&
             !puHdlr->fill(*pPURaw,*pEvt,nPtrPU,30,1,Vertex::PILEUP) )
       {
         // get the full particle level event
         std::vector<fastjet::PseudoJet> fullEvt = pEvt->pseudoJets();
         // get the particle level pile-up
         std::vector<fastjet::PseudoJet> puEvt = pEvt->pseudoJets(Vertex::PILEUP);
         // get the particle level signal 
         std::vector<fastjet::PseudoJet> sigEvt = pEvt->pseudoJets(Vertex::SIGNAL);
         .....            // your analysis
         pEvt->reset();   // do not forget!!!  
       }

std::vector< fastjet::PseudoJet > Event::pseudoJets ( bool  charged,
int  vtx = -1 
) [virtual]

void Event::reset (  )  [virtual]

Reset all Event caches.

This method need to be invoked by the client before building a new event.

[in] vtxId return number of particles from given vertex (optional, default -1 means sum particles from all vertices)

const Vertex & Event::vertex ( int  vtxId = -1  )  const [virtual]

Retrieve specific vertex.

Parameters:
0] vtx id of vertex to be retrieved (optional, default is first vertex in list, specified by `vtxId = -1`)
Note:
The list of vertices in the Event is not ordered per se. The first vertex has only special meaning if in case of a signal event merged with pile-up, the vertex id offset was chosen such that e.g. `vtxId = -1` means signal vertex. This is strongly relying on a notation controlled by the client.

const std::vector< Vertex > & Event::vertices (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Retrieve all vertices.

Returns:
Reference to non-modifiable list of vertices in Event.

Member Data Documentation

std::vector<std::vector<fastjet::PseudoJet> > Event::m_particles [mutable, private]

Cache for particles in event.

The external container is indexed by vertex id (>= 0). This means the cache cannot accommodate invalid vertices with id < 0.

For each vertex, a list of particles is attached.

std::vector<std::vector<fastjet::PseudoJet> > Event::m_partons [mutable, private]

Cache for partons in event.

Has the same structure as Event::m_particles but is presently not filled.

std::vector<Vertex> Event::m_vertices [mutable, private]

Cache for vertices.

This cache is index parallel to Event::m_particles. It contains the full specification for each vertex, as provided by the Vertex object.
